title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Are we in a recession? Maybe professional Santas can tell us
items.description: Demand for professional Santas and other seasonal workers seems to have cooled. Could that be a sign we're in a recession?

items.title: Black bear populations are bouncing back. Here's how these Texas towns are coping
items.description: Historically, Black bears were the biggest predator to travel the Big Bend area of Texas. But overhunting and habitat loss led to their decline.

items.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine will not cede any territory to Russia as part of deal
items.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is saying Ukraine will not be ceding any territory to Russia as part of a peace plan. CBS News' Ramy Inocencio reports.

items.title: Sacked agents sue FBI, saying they were punished for taking the knee
items.description: The group say adopting a gesture used by protesters helped to defuse tensions during a 2020 demonstration.

items.title: Trump announces $12 billion aid package for U.S. farmers
items.description: The new financial aid package is expected to shore up the U.S. agricultural sector, which has been hurt by tariffs and a trade war with China.

items.title: ICE arrests of Afghans are on the rise in the wake of National Guard attack, immigration lawyers say
items.description: Immigration lawyers and authorities say arrests of Afghans are on the rise following the shooting of two National Guard members in Washington, D.C.

items.title: CCTV shows suspects make off on foot with stolen artworks
items.description: Brazilian officials say thieves held up a security guard and an elderly couple before making off with the artworks on foot in São Paulo.

Trump criticises 'weak' European leaders over Ukraine and immigration
items.description: In his latest public criticism of Europe, the US president claims countries are "decaying".

items.title: French feminists outraged by Brigitte Macron's comment about activists
items.description: There has been pushback to the term used by France's first lady to describe activists who interrupted comedian Ary Abittan's show.

items.title: A coup too far: Why Benin's rebel soldiers failed where others in the region succeeded
items.description: Plotters misjudged the national mood and Benin's neighbours learnt from past errors, says analyst Paul Melly.
